website_summaries.verdict: A minimalist, "no frills" spinner that requires a bit of elbow grease.

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly durable and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This salad spinner is pretty simple to use and lasts surprisingly long time. My first exact spinner lasted more than 5 years and eventually the plastic inner basket started to break and the bowl stained to an ugly brown color. I like how its construction doesn't contain too many parts, meaning it will have less parts to break. Just put the veges in, close the lid and give it a whirl and most of the water will be drained.
customer_reviews.author: Jidanmei Ran

customer_reviews.title: Pros & Cons
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Price is amazing It's a nice size It's non-skid base works well Water doesn't leak while in use Cons: The knob hurts my hand It very stiff and hard to turn Basket is kinda flimsy Ikea designed, but Made in China Overall, it will do in a pinch, but I probably won't be using it that much.
customer_reviews.author: The Texas Review

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use Salad spinner
customer_reviews.text: Salad spinner is easy to use and easy to clean without taking up too much room when storing. Also sturdy and safety bottom keeps it from slipping on the counter. Very happy with mine so I gave one to my future daughter in law! P.S. she liked it too!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does its job.
customer_reviews.text: The outside container is very solid, and even the basket isn't so bad. It holds an entire regular sized bag of salad mix. It does lose some of the smaller pieces that come with the salad kits, but not a big issue. The spinner is a little hard to spin, and I have to hold it in my arms to spin, but hopefully as I use it more, it will loosen up. It does the job I need it to do, and not bad for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amy's Bookshelf Reviews

customer_reviews.title: and I'm glad I decided to go with this one
customer_reviews.text: I had been searching for a salad spinner for months, and I'm glad I decided to go with this one. It isn't unnecessarily pricey (like those at the supermarket), and it is extremely durable and does its job well. My mom has had this same spinner for years, and it is still in like-new condition. Holds one head of lettuce and so is perfect for a small/medium sized family. Definitely glad I bought this--haven't noticed any downsides yet!
customer_reviews.author: Karigan

customer_reviews.title: The concept is good, but I had to put the spinner on ...
customer_reviews.text: The concept is good, but I had to put the spinner on the sink countertop wedged againgst my stomach to hold on to the bowl and use a dishrag to hold the spinner handle, only dried lettuce so so
customer_reviews.author: Therese65

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat the price
customer_reviews.text: My wife wanted one of these. I read a lot of reviews and for once in my life decided to cheap out, because none of the reviews raved about the spinners, even the expensive ones. This thing is very flimsy, but we have spun a lot of homegrown lettuce in it so far, and it has held up perfectly. It's not that large, which is great because it fits in a drawer, but is large enough to handle a salad for 4 people. It weighs nothing, cleans easily and does what it is designed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Pimenator

customer_reviews.title: It is mechanical so it doesn't look like it can break
customer_reviews.text: Study and does the job... Pros:It is mechanical so it doesn't look like it can break. Cons:This isnt really a con, but it is kind of small... If you have a big family, then this may be too small for you. Since it is only my girl and I, this is big enough for us and does the job... Buy it, you cant go wrong!!!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: A great deal
customer_reviews.text: I bought this almost a year ago, and use it pretty much every day. It still works as well as the day I bought it. I think I paid $5 for it. You can't beat that! It's large enough to spin salad for several people, easy to clean, works like a charm, and is insanely cheap. It's not fancy, but it does what it needs to do for a fraction of the cost of other salad spinners. Very pleased with this.
customer_reviews.author: fsg

customer_reviews.title: it is a good product. You just have to get the barrel ...
customer_reviews.text: It's $6 at Ikea - none the less, it is a good product. You just have to get the barrel in the center first before you spin. I like the compact size and simplicity.
customer_reviews.author: PVAllegria

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good salad spinner
customer_reviews.text: This salad spinner is perfect for what I use it for. I use it to spin lettuce for my 4 person family. It's best to just put a little lettuce at a time into the spinner. If you put too much, your lettuce will not spin dry. I only gave it 4 stars because it's a little awkward to hold and turn the handle at the same time. It does have a rubber grip on the bottom, but it doesn't stay on the counter. It's a great price and it gets the job done!
customer_reviews.author: S. Gilmore

customer_reviews.title: Weak spinner.
customer_reviews.text: Does not spin fast enough especially with anything but a small amount of lettuce. It becomes almost impossible to develop enough rotational speed to remove the water. It also feels like it is going to strip the gears if I turn it any harder. Bottom line expect to spin several small (two or three leaf loads) in lieu of a large load.
customer_reviews.author: miker

customer_reviews.title: satisfied with this salad spinner
customer_reviews.text: this is a great salad spinner. it is rather small but does make enough salad for two people. it takes less space on the counter. it is way overpriced here at Amazon. I got it from ikea for $4.99. but with shipping cost it probably still be a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: Buy Good Grips - has push button top and is twice ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a most impossible salad spinner - neither I nor my husband could operate this cheap product without a tremendous amount of muscle. Buy Good Grips - has push button top and is twice the price but 200% worth it.
customer_reviews.author: clicker

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is my second salad spinner. The first model I had was hard to clean and clumsy to use. This is so easy. Wish I had bought it first.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Saves food prep time.
customer_reviews.text: Spin away. Quick way to throw together a nice salad, and you could serve directly from it as long as you don't dress your salad in advance. Great for washing berries and small veggies like baby carrots.
customer_reviews.author: The Punk

customer_reviews.title: Very good at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Great little salad spinner. Sturdy and turns easily if you place on a good surface and hold it properly.
customer_reviews.author: superdave

customer_reviews.title: Broken!!!
customer_reviews.text: the inside strainer bowl was broken, doesn't spin!!! Thought it would be of good quality coming from Ikea, never again! Threw it out!!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon L.

customer_reviews.title: the mesh bowl warped a little in the dishwasher making ...
customer_reviews.text: the mesh bowl warped a little in the dishwasher making it hard to spin. Hand wash only. It still works, but I have to put it in just right.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey S Spatz

customer_reviews.title: Works good!
customer_reviews.text: Good for price. Does as it's suppose to, just gets hard to turn when there's too much water or weight in it.
customer_reviews.author: Tee94

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to hold with wet hands
customer_reviews.text: Works ok, but a little difficult to get spinning. Not easy to hold with wet hands! I searched for the cheapest salad spinner, so I guess I got what I paid for!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money. If you try and spin more than 1 oz of lettuce, cauliflower, etc. it jams. You might be able to spin a few ounces of water.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Too small to do more than small amount at a time. Not very effective. Have had others in past that did better job.
customer_reviews.author: Jody

customer_reviews.title: works great for me and my girlfriend if we're making 2 ...
customer_reviews.text: This isn't a huge salad spinner, works great for me and my girlfriend if we're making 2 good sized salads for dinner (main course). I would get a bigger one if you're looking to make salad for a whole family.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Bowen

customer_reviews.title: My first spinner - I love it.
customer_reviews.text: Spinner is just as described. I filled it up with garden fresh kale and leaf lettuce - it spun all the water out and left the leaves clean and dry. The construction seems sturdy enough and the basket held more than I could eat.
customer_reviews.author: Michigan customer

customer_reviews.title: but not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: A little small and gets kinda stuck if the lid isn't on JUST right, but not bad for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Burkhart

customer_reviews.title: Perfecto !
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great! It does exactly what it is supposed to do and I can leave the lettuce in there and it stays crisp. I only paid like 10 or 15 bucks for this one and I have seen spinners in JC Penney's for $50! I'm so glad I didn't buy one of the others. Thanks, Ikea!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: spinning samples or salads
customer_reviews.text: it works well for what we use it for in our lab (make-shift centrifuge), so I assume that it would work well for salads, too!
customer_reviews.author: Peko

customer_reviews.title: Do not like it!
customer_reviews.text: Very small and difficult to use. I have trigger thumb and to grab the handle to spin puts pressure on that area, very uncomfortable. I had my friend try it to determine if it was just my thumb problem, but was also difficult for her. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: I hate wet lettuce but I have a budget
customer_reviews.text: I opted for this one based on the price... Most spinners are $30+. I hate wet lettuce but I have a budget! This thing is perfect. Reasonably priced and works exactly as it should. It's smaller than most spinners but for the price if I have to spin a head of romaine in two batches I'm ok with that. Thanks IKEA.
customer_reviews.author: KristeninGR

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Good size, doesn't take up a lot of space, yet holds plenty of lettuce/spinach. Easy to spin, easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie's mom

customer_reviews.title: Love this spinner
customer_reviews.text: I'm visiting my mother for a long-term stay and I didn't want to buy a $25 salad spinner since I had one back home. Other than the small size, this salad spinner is great. Makes me wonder why I spent $25 dollars on the one I have at my home. I won't make that mistake again. This is a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: simple and effective
customer_reviews.text: This simple to use and easy to clean little gadget is a winner. will hold one head of ice berg lettuce or 2 to 3 bunches of romaine lettuce. the simple spin handle mechanism makes it easy to operate and difficult to break. This is a winner both with price and quality. it will also be nice to use with berries and grapes.
customer_reviews.author: Family Music

customer_reviews.title: spend more money on a more sturdy salad spinner
customer_reviews.text: Flimsy. Small. Unless you are a student with no space and a small budget, spend more money on a more sturdy salad spinner.
customer_reviews.author: NadiaS

customer_reviews.title: We love the salad spinner granted we use it to make ...
customer_reviews.text: We love the salad spinner granted we use it to make spin art we still have yet to use it on salad
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Brown

customer_reviews.title: I have had this previously and ended up losing it ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had this previously and ended up losing it during a move. Bought this because it was cheap and I used it before. My only problem is that it's not dishwasher safe! Had I known I wouldn't have purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Ashleigh Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's a salad spinner, wont change your life but will keep you from eating soggy lettuce...
customer_reviews.author: Phil T

customer_reviews.title: Compact, sturdy, it works
customer_reviews.text: I liked that it was delivered before time and that the vegetable spinner by Ikea is sturdy, has smooth rotation of basket and a compact design for easy storage
customer_reviews.author: benew

customer_reviews.title: Good Salad spinner
customer_reviews.text: Good Salad spinner. If I had the time to go to an Ikea I would buy in store since its about half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Rsar823

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done at a good price
customer_reviews.text: Works great and is very handy to store the lettuce in after I spin it. It even stays fresher than when I keep it it another Tupperware bowl. Overall very happy I picked this spinner.
customer_reviews.author: Corrie the reviewer

customer_reviews.title: this salad spinner is great! I would recommend buying this directly from Ikea ...
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this salad spinner is great! I would recommend buying this directly from Ikea to save money, but the price is pretty low here too.
customer_reviews.author: SLS

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job
customer_reviews.text: This spinner works very well. For our purposes, it is the right size and is easy to use. I have used it for over a month now and had no problems or issues. The price is pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Beachwalker5

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This salad spinner is just perfect for my needs, and I love it. It definitely does what it is supposed to and is actually very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: better than nothing
customer_reviews.text: I wish it was a bit larger, or i could generate some higher RPMs to really get the water off, better than nothing though
customer_reviews.author: colin

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Was too small had to return it and buy a larger one.
customer_reviews.author: Candace Wylie

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality for the price. Gave as a gift. Since it was a gift, I had hoped that it would come in a product box, but just came wrapped in cellophane. Not impressive looking when giving as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Great for my uses
customer_reviews.text: This is great for someone who cooks for just one. I like to buy fresh produce but it often goes bad before I get a chance to eat it all. This allows me to buy lettuce (any greens, really) and it keeps for much longer. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Alison

customer_reviews.title: Works ok but fairly flimsy
customer_reviews.text: It works decently but the product is fairly flimsy. Mine is a bit mashed after only a bit of use, and it now spins unevenly.
customer_reviews.author: bigandrew

customer_reviews.title: small, twice the price at ikea
customer_reviews.text: a bit small, but otherwise works as expected. Note that the ikea price is half of what you pay for this.
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: Fine product in theory but very cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Fine product in theory but very cheaply made. Arrived with the outer bowl badly cracked. To get a refund I'm required to print a shipping label and do not have a printer. So am just out the money :-(
customer_reviews.author: ArtingInMuhPJs

customer_reviews.title: good spinning
customer_reviews.text: This is my third salad spinner. The first two push down on a lever to make it spin just broke. You can't fix them. This one is more manually oriented. Surprisingly even though you don't achieve the speed of a push down or pull string (another type with parts to break), the water still comes off your lettuce with your manual turning. It's more direct, you spin the top knob and the basket spins,it's sturdy, solid, and I believe I won't be able to break it even if I tried to. I"m going to see if Ikea makes one with a bit bigger basket.
customer_reviews.author: salad eater

customer_reviews.title: Cost-ef
customer_reviews.text: Love this salad spinner. Easy to spin. Gets out plenty of water/moisture. Perfect size for 1 or 2 person salad greens. Good seal. Seems sufficiently sturdy. A good buy.
customer_reviews.author: A careful buyer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love it. I needed a smaller salad spinner when it's just for myself. It dries the lettuce just fine
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: It's serving us well
customer_reviews.text: This is a sturdy, little salad spinner. I had purchased a more expensive one from Costco that ended up breaking. They have this where I work and I decided to purchase one since it has lasted them a while. We love to eat salads so we use it a lot and it hasn't given us any issue.
customer_reviews.author: E&C

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Seems to be very durable & it spins the water off really well. It shipped quickly.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Okay salad spinner. a little small IMO. Takes some spinning to get the water off the vegie.
customer_reviews.author: S.

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: This is a little flimsy but it works. I like how tight the lid fits.
customer_reviews.author: zentrainer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: works pretty good - not terribly big so you have to do batches.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. T

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I would prefer it to be bigger, but it works well. Upper deck dishwasher only.
customer_reviews.author: V. Detering

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love the small size and the spinning is easy to do.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Fan!!

customer_reviews.title: it's just fine. I read that the spring action spinners can ...
customer_reviews.text: Does everything I needed it to: spins water off lettuce. It can't handle a big amount so if you're looking for washing and drying a LOT, maybe not the spinner for you. But for one person, it's just fine. I read that the spring action spinners can break, so that's why I went with this one, it's a manually operated spin mechanism. However if you have any weakness in your arm, wrist, etc., it's not for you either.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle LaVigne

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: Product is easy to use and effective. I was able to fit enough lettuce to spin for a salad for four people.
customer_reviews.author: Karin D.

customer_reviews.title: Best helper
customer_reviews.text: I have looked at others like this in the stores and some magazines that I get via mail, and this was far better in price and what I needed. I actually bought one for my son too who loves to cook.
customer_reviews.author: Dottie

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: You can buy this its gets so much water off your lettuce.!
customer_reviews.author: Zara

customer_reviews.title: Its a lot smaller than I thought
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than I thought. Its easy to clean. Will be interring as to how well it holds up
customer_reviews.author: Sheila S.

customer_reviews.title: ... you have everything lined up well) but it works great, especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: A little finicky (only in making sure you have everything lined up well) but it works great, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: James Hunsberger

customer_reviews.title: Does wet lettuce really grind your gears?
customer_reviews.text: With the IKEA TOKIG Salad Spinner my lettuce is dry, and I am a contented man.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Dunbebin

customer_reviews.title: Works great - and at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: We've used several spinners and this one is the least expensive, and works just as well as any of the others. This is the one we'll be giving as gifts!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Dave

customer_reviews.title: Quite pleased.
customer_reviews.text: This works VERY well for my mixed green and other veggies that I let soak in water. Quite pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Bones

customer_reviews.title: Works well for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice salad spinner for the price. It isn't the best built one I have seen but for the price, it does exactly what it needs to.
customer_reviews.author: mike mcnertney

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Keeps salad fresh for a very long time (think I've had lettuce from it after 2-3 weeks of it sitting in my fridge). Definitely worth it and not very expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Ramona Powers

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fit a head of romaine easily. Makes a perfect side salad for our family of 5.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Jane

customer_reviews.title: Does what it should do. Clean crisp lettuce with out the extra water.
customer_reviews.text: YaY. It works. Why pay thirty bucks for a name brand.
customer_reviews.author: AmyLulu

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality. The insert needs to sit on the ...
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality. The insert needs to sit on the base exactly or it won't spin and it's difficult to get it to match up once the lettuce is in it.
customer_reviews.author: Jc

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Solid product, does well what it was made to do.
customer_reviews.author: Shirin Amini

customer_reviews.title: Clean greens!
customer_reviews.text: Basic spinner. Gets the job done. A bit smaller than others,but fits in the refrigerator well that way.
customer_reviews.author: jack g

customer_reviews.title: Seems a bit flimsy but works fine. I have fresh lettuce from my garden and ...
customer_reviews.text: Seems a bit flimsy but works fine. I have fresh lettuce from my garden and use it often. Not issues to report.
customer_reviews.author: kimberly k weishaupt

customer_reviews.title: It spins veggies. Yay.
customer_reviews.text: It spins salads. And kids really enjoy playing with it if that matters.
customer_reviews.author: Matt M

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: After spending more money on a different salad spinner which was so flimsy, this Ikea Salad Spinner is a delight to use.
customer_reviews.author: CHAD H COLE

customer_reviews.title: Basic spinner, works but nothing special.
customer_reviews.text: It's a salad spinner. It does exactly what it's supposed to do. Although it has an annoying whirring noise when in use.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Radin

customer_reviews.title: Really good value!
customer_reviews.text: Great value. The bowl might be a tad bit smaller than what I'm used to, but it still manages to fit all of the greens I need in one go-round. It works well and was offered at a great price compared to the others. I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon 1234

customer_reviews.title: probably not dishwasher safe
customer_reviews.text: It came without any directions, so I have to assume it is not dishwasher safe. It does work, but I would have liked to put it in the machine after.
customer_reviews.author: vickyann

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Spins well - easy to clean. Glad I chose this one.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne Brown

customer_reviews.title: easy clean up
customer_reviews.text: Simple to use and spins out water, easy clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Sue W

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my girls (3). Sturdy and just big enough. Wish I didn't have the big salad spinner already. :(
customer_reviews.author: Cnthea

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love love love it. Just hard to spin. Wish I got a bigger size
customer_reviews.author: NinaB

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: Works very welll. Smaller than I thought, so I just spin in batches.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as described! Simple, easy to clean!! Exactly what I would expect from a cheapo regular ikea spinner! Thanks and cheers!
customer_reviews.author: C84

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: got this for my husband, he loves it, had one once before and had been unable to find one in any store in town...thank you.
customer_reviews.author: S. Howe

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very cheap. Wears out your wrist fast. Cheaper from Ikea themselves. Not worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Rachyl

customer_reviews.title: Works but is smaller than I thought
customer_reviews.text: This does exactly what it is suppose to do. My only issue is that it's smaller than what I had imagined and takes up alot of room in the kitchen cabinet. But for the price, you really can't beat it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon purchaser

customer_reviews.title: love it!
customer_reviews.text: It works, and it's super easy to use, clean, and the perfect size for 2 or 3 people. Excellent deal.
customer_reviews.author: Make it Funny

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love the size, not so huge so it is easier to find a place in the cupboard
customer_reviews.author: Diane Olson

customer_reviews.title: Same excellent strategy for most Ikea products
customer_reviews.text: Simple, inexpensive device that works well. Same excellent strategy for most Ikea products.
customer_reviews.author: DFWG1

customer_reviews.title: Works easy, sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Works just fine, easy to use. It's really sturdy and I'll probably have it for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Chantelle

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: A bit small, but works well, cleans easier than others I've had
customer_reviews.author: jbred

customer_reviews.title: Handy Kitchen Tool
customer_reviews.text: Good product, a little hard to turn, but it does exactly what I needed it to do, which is to drain the water from the lettuce.
customer_reviews.author: S Sheppard

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: A bit hard to turn but overall, for the price, it does the trick!
customer_reviews.author: Chriss714

customer_reviews.title: You have to be careful not to press down on the lid too hard while trying to spin or it will stop the spin like a brake
customer_reviews.text: Works well. You have to be careful not to press down on the lid too hard while trying to spin or it will stop the spin like a brake. Other than that, this is a good product that my wife and I use almost everyday and wee have been pleased with it. If you are trying to serve more than 2 people a dinner portion of salad and intend to use this spinner, you might have to split your salad into batches or get a bigger spinner. If you are looking for an inexpensive spinner, I would recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Gilliosa

customer_reviews.title: It's good but a lil dangerous
customer_reviews.text: Love: Once you get the spinner going it's actually fun. It's easy to clean. Love using the bowl as my salad bowl. Gets the job done and way less costly than other spinners. Hate: I made the mistake of rinsing out the bowl with my hand. Huuuuuge mistake. There's a clear sharp nubby spike in the middle of the bowl that will draw blood if you're not careful. If you must clean by hand avoid the nubby spike unless you want a bit of blood dressing in your salad.
customer_reviews.author: Khaleesi

product_meta.title: Ikea 60148678, White
product_meta.description: Size:1 TOKIG Salad SpinnerIkea 601.486.78 Tokig Salad Spinner, White
feature_bullets: The bowl can also be used for serving
